page.title: 12MADELEY STAFFS : HEALTH
page.content: The main ailments of the old,in Madeley are rheumatism from the damp situation, & chest complaints-a legacy of work in the mines.Many are overweight & have high blood pressure.Younger people are more weight & health conscious,& keen on preventive medicine.They take advan- tage of scans for cancer & immunisation & checks in children's development.The elderly are visited & advised about aids & social services eg. home helps & meals on wheels. There is a medical team of 3 doctors, 1 sister,3 district nurses,1 midwife ,1 health visitor & 1 dentist,to serve Madeley & district.Lea House is an Old People's Home,for 32 residents & 2-6 taking daily lunch.No special facility exists fort the disabled.The nearest hospital is in Newcastle,7 miles away but the ambulance station is only 5 minutes away.
